intro: Crocodeilanthe tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui fern, is a rare epiphytic plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments at high elevations, often growing on rock surfaces or tree trunks. Its unique morphology and restricted habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists studying endemic species. Due to its limited distribution and fragility, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat destruction.
